sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the S&P 500 index, there is noteworthy activity today in American Express Co. (Symbol: AXP), where a total volume of 18,829 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 1.9 million underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 59.8% of AXP's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.1 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $90 strike call option expiring July 21, 2017 , with 2,939 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 293,900 underlying shares of AXP.

Below is a chart showing AXP's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $90 strike highlighted in orange:

Salesforce.com Inc (Symbol: CRM) options are showing a volume of 18,968 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 1.9 million underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 51.6% of CRM's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.7 million shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $105 strike call option expiring September 15, 2017 , with 5,586 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 558,600 underlying shares of CRM.

Below is a chart showing CRM's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $105 strike highlighted in orange:

And Valero Energy Corp (Symbol: VLO) saw options trading volume of 17,766 contracts, representing approximately 1.8 million underlying shares or approximately 49.5% of VLO's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 3.6 million shares.

Especially high volume was seen for the $62.50 strike put option expiring September 15, 2017 , with 10,045 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 1.0 million underlying shares of VLO.

Below is a chart showing VLO's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $62.50 strike highlighted in orange:
